Reviews.Title: Great Phone for Elderly Dad
Reviews.Author: BMH
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone as a present for my elderly father who can not hear well on a standard cellular telephone. It works GREAT. Not only can he hear it ring, hear the person on the other end, but you hear him clearer than you hear someone talking on a standard cell phone! It has large buttons that are easy for him to press. The only drawback is lack of features. If you want just a basic telephone for an older person with hearing and site issues, with not many bells and whistles, this one is perfect.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: T. Dang
Reviews.Content: Bought for my mother-in-law who has macular degeneration. Using on Att network. She loves it. Volume Great. Reception very good. Battery life OK. Menus are a little screwy, but what do you expect with something this simple. Reading and writing texts a little difficult, but I would be amazed if she ever used it for that.

Reviews.Title: Nice Little Cell Phone...Almost.
Reviews.Author: William T. Cole Jr. "wcole67"
Reviews.Content: I'm not much of a phone guy, and especially with these recent cell phones that are expensive to buy and expensive to operate...and have all those bells and whistles that i'll never use. All a waste of money for me.But now I'm getting up in age and I decided I should have some sort of wireless emergency notification device that I could carry around with me...just in case. I think there are some companies that sell a device you hang around your neck with an emergency button on it. I'm not sure how it all works but I assume there's a monthly charge for the priviledge of pressing this button....Nahhhh. not for me.Then I saw the "Just5" Cell Phone on Amazon and it looked rather interesting. Basically a simple cell phone with no gimmicks (camera, internet, games, etc.) It was quite small, had large numbers on the keys, and a nickel sized (big) orange button on the back of the phone that could be programmed to dial 5 phone numbers in succession.(the "SOS Button" must be held for about 5 seconds before anything happens). If no one answered the first number, it would automatically move on to the second number and dial it...and so on. If no one answered any of the 5 numbers it would then jump to Emergency 911 and dial it. A very nice feature and just what I was looking for. There are some other minor emergency features too but I won't get into them here. Plus now I had a "walkabout" phone too.I bought a refurbished phone from one of Amazons top rated vendors for a very low price (less than $30.00) and it was sitting in my mailbox in a few days. It was packed in a nice little "Just5" gift box with all the accessories, a separately packaged battery, a wall charger and an instruction manual. If it was reburbished, I couldn't tell..everything looked brand new (and packed like new) to me. I slipped in the SIM card (see below) and the battery after easily snapping off the back cover panel (it snapped back on just as easily). I charged up the phone and it was now ready for ACTIVATION.Now this phone is "UNLOCKED" which means you are NOT "tied in" to any specific phone carrier. You can pick and choose. You can buy a SIM card which slips into the phone, under the battery. You must ACTIVATE the SIM card however before the phone will work. I bought a T-MOBILE Sim card at Amazon for about $6.00 with about $3.00 worth of free minutes (half hour talk time)on it. Then you must call T-Mobile (on another phone obviously) and go through a TEDIOUS (to me) activation routine. I finally got a "Real Person" after struggling to talk to a computer and gave them all the required information and got my new phone number.I went on their "Pay As You Go" (Prepaid) plan. $100.00 for 1000 minutes for one year. And you can always buy more minutes if needed. Since I'm not a big phone "rag chewer", this will suit me just fine.(So for $8.33 a moth, I get 1.4 hours (83 minutes) of talk time per month...Plenty for me. And there are oodles of other plans, just pick the one that best suits you. No contracts, no credit checks, etc.  But for long "rag chews" I'll stay with my "land line".What's not to like on the this cell phone? The Menu Setup. Trying to read the manual and follow the Menu Instructions left me literally "crosseyed".If you are giving this phone to a non-tech older person, they will not...I repeat....they will NOT be able to set the phone up properly. Trying to follow the instructions and press the right button is definitely user-UNfriendly.They will absolutely need HELP.But once it is set up it'll work just fine for a non techie.

Reviews.Title: Just 5 brought back the electricity
Reviews.Author: Lynn M. Wilde
Reviews.Content: Since my dad died recently, I decided to get my 86 year old mother a cell phone, her first.  Mom had never selected a long distance company for the home phone, so the cell phone would fulfill that function.  I wanted a simple one.  I set it up for her and sent it.  She called recently to tell my how useful it was when a truck hit the utility pole late one evening, knocking out electricity and phone service in her home and others.  She was able to use the cell phone to contact AT&T; and the electric company.  My mom also finds the radio nice to have with her out in the garden and around the house.  She promises me that she keeps it with her during the day and at her bedside at night.  I'm happy that she has not had to use the personal Emergency Response System, but grateful that it's there.  We are on opposite coasts.

Reviews.Title: Great, simple phone
Reviews.Author: J. Hetherington
Reviews.Content: We recently purchased this phone for my mother and we are both very impressed with it. It has a good feel, is easily dialed, easily read and all basic functions are also very simple to perform.Due to the small size and small LED screen, navigating the menu isn't as intuitive as more traditional phones but doesn't require a degree, or even a manual as ours shipped without one. Overall I wouldhighly recommend this to anyone seeking  simple phone, senior or otherwise. My mothers is being used on the T-Mobile network so I cannot speak to the quality of the Just Five network.Pro's:* Size, appearance, design* Loud, clear, speaker and microphone, remarkable sound especially considering the size* Emergency Dial Feature (SOS button)* Price / value* LED light is great* Has external switches for many features so navigating menu's isn't necessary for volume, LED light, Phone Lock/Unlock, Radio* Good battery life and a nice chargerQuestionable or Con's:* FM radio really necessary for a Seniors phone? - I doubt many will use it* Case material could be textured or rubber coated to make handling such a small phone safer and more comfortable* headset, again, unnecessary and I doubt many will use it* Did not include an owners manual but Did include a quick start guide (Owners manual quickly found searching Google)* Ringtone selections were pretty badAgain, if you are considering this phone and the features suit your needs I am confidant you will be satisfied. Know the phonesdimensions are 4 inches by 2 inches wide, so it is a very small phone but makes carrying and storing it much easier. I currentlyuse a Nexus One $565 smart phone and will be ordering one of these for myself to use as a simple phone and as a backup phone.

Reviews.Title: My Mom Loves It
Reviews.Author: Courtney S. Putnam "C.S. Putnam"
Reviews.Content: This is the second "senior phone" I have purchased for my mother.  The first one came directly from China and had too many Chinese issues to make it work for her.  I decided to try this phone (even though it cost more) because it claims to be from a European company and I thought the language issue would be less of an issue.This phone came packaged in a beautiful box with very easy to read instructions.  The charger cord is bright orange which makes it easy for my mom to figure out which cord she needs for her phone.  The ring tone selection is limited, but it has a tone she enjoys so she's fine with the limitation.  The SOS feature works great on this phone (it didn't work at all on the Chinese phone) and we had fun testing it out when the phone first arrived.  Auto text to several people then auto call to several people until someone picks up.  After her call is answered, her phone automatically goes to speakerphone and she can easily talk into the phone.FM radio is a silly option and she hasn't done much texting yet, but she tells me she really loves this phone.  Technology may be great for most folks, but for some the bells and whistles simply create stress and headaches.  I would highly recommend this phone for someone who wants a simple, yet high quality phone that kind of stands out in a smart phone heavy society.

Reviews.Title: Rubbish
Reviews.Author: Charles W. Funaro
Reviews.Content: Worst phone I ever owned.  The first phone (yes, I know, fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me) stopped working entirely within 60 days after purchase, and neither the retailer nor the manufacturer would honor the warranty.  The second phone failed in stages, disconnecting calls, lock switch fail.  This cheap Chinese piece of doodoo has a non-standard headset 3.5 mm pin configuration, despite the advertising which says the phone is compatible with Blackberry/iPhone headsets.  I tried multiple iPhone compatible headsets, all with ZERO success. Same with the charger -- but luckily I found an obscure Nokia replacement charger by examining the charger which came with the phone, and measuring the pin. Oh yes, the headset supplied with the first phone died.  Now both phones and all accessories are sitting in a box in my office -- if anybody wants them for spare parts.  This phone may be ok for EXTREMELY light use, but definitely not for business (i.e., 10 phone calls per day killed them).

Reviews.Title: It doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Nautilus60
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for a handicapped person with coordination challenges.  The side buttons keep getting in the way of the hand grasp, if a mistake is made in pushing buttons the screen has to be reset, and to top it off, the phone, even on the AT&T; network where other phones were working beautifully, could not make or receive even one call.  It was a waste of money and a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my mom despite hearing aids & shaky hands!
Reviews.Author: B. Noia
Reviews.Content: My mom would never use a cell phone--hated even regular phones--but now she is getting to like her JustJ509: the keys are big enough that even her shaky, arthritic hands can manage them; she likes the speed dials I programmed for her children and doctor, and the shape and size of the phone makes it something she holds better than any other cell phone she's tried, and she can slip it into a pocket and keep with her ALL THE TIME, which means she can always be in touch!  Most phones have given her a problem with her severe hearing loss/hearing aids; this phone works very well--anyhow, better than other cell phones--in that area...so now instead of resisting using the phone, she will use it, though it is still not her preferred manner of communication. The panic button on the back is a great idea; makes her feel more free to go about on her own, knowing she could easily call for help should she need to--and this makes us her 'children' feel more at ease about her independent ramblings, too. Good as the phone is for her, it's even better for us--we are scattered all over the world, in now that she has a manageable cell phone, we can reach her from anywhere, anytime! The only complaint we have is that the speakerphone is unclear; the audio so bad that even I, with fine hearing, won't use it.  But that's no reason to avoid this great solution for seniors!

Reviews.Title: Great for an Older Guy
Reviews.Author: S. Dotty
Reviews.Content: We bought this for a man who is getting older and having problems with his eye sight.  He really enjoys the ease of this phone.

Reviews.Title: Not unlocked! Did not work with overseas sim-card.
Reviews.Author: A. S "A. S."
Reviews.Content: They say the phone is unlocked - but it is not. Had purchased it for my mom. She took it overseas and it did not work with the international sim. Other than that the phone is fine for use within the country. However, the battery dies pretty fast even though she barely uses it.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Riana Collins
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my sister who has seizures and sometimes need assistance, the SOS feature has given me and her great peace of mind. The most awesome thing about this is the ease of use for her, or anyone who is not so tech savvy. Easy to understand, use, and great call quality. This is the second one I have purchased for her, first one was lost. Cannot say enough about the product and purchase, great choice.

Reviews.Title: Phone for senior citizen
Reviews.Author: Alan Barker
Reviews.Content: Excellent phone, works as advertised. Easy for my father to use, loud speaker, big buttons. Simple installation of sim card, and works fine on the AT&T; network. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: It do not work
Reviews.Author: Jogisa
Reviews.Content: I brougth this celular three weeks ago, at first it was working well, nevertheless, right now the celular stop working, I carried to repair, but they told me that the celular is dead, so, I waist my money.

Reviews.Title: Just 5 Cell phone!
Reviews.Author: Angela Turin
Reviews.Content: Nice little phone easy to use and the loudness on the ear volume and ringing volume was very load,the keys were nice size and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great product, simple and powerful enough. Slightly smaller than I thought
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Munoz
Reviews.Content: Today there is very much technology and prices really affordable. But maybe too much and in some cases we simply do not need that at least at the surface. That is the case of some senior ladies I love much and shared with me their need, the same need, to have a simple yet powerful mobile.We were looking for large numbers, just big numbers a red and green buttons and large screen. Long last batteries, quick recharge and chances to have quick dial simply by pressing one of the numbers more than 1 sec and dial. Exactly all such requirements were present in these units, amazing quick charge and added an extra feature which is a big red button at the back which act as panic. It requires somebody else to program and load with information because the device has some power inside, because it is not that simple. Maybe this is the ONLY comment. If this device is for simple and senior people, the setup should be also simple. Somehow...maybe a video, maybe a simple program step by step and transfer all data and setup by an USB, etc.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: TruckTurner
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my mom as she needs a phone that's simple. Phone is pretty straight forward. Loud. These are pros. What I don't like is it's smaller than I thought it would be and, most importantly, IT DOESN'T WORK!! I've called it many times and it goes straight to voicemail (unavailable). Tried to dial out and nothing happens. It's like if it doesn't show 100% signal strength it won't work at all! I thought this was the answer but it's obviously just another problem.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone!
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Very good phone was easy to operate, would recommend for the elderly, easy to see display, loud ringer, easy to use menu and key pad...

Reviews.Title: Good Phone, But, .......
Reviews.Author: John C. "ProMariner"
Reviews.Content: I was searching for an easy to use phone for my Mom who has macular degeneration and is legally blind.  She needs something that is simple.  This phone is just, well .......... ok.It has some useless functions like a flashlight and an FM radio, but lacks some very needed ones.I've read the manual over and over and I can't find a speaker function, so it can not be used hands free.  My Mom could answer her old Motorola and set it down on the table so we could all talk to out of state relatives, but this one doesn't have that capability.  She has to hold this one to her ear.  It is amplified, but the speaker function on her old phone was louder.  And the display is really not any larger than her old Motorola Razor.  The buttons are larger, which helps.  The multiple programmable speed dial buttons are a very good feature though.  You can program contacts to be dialed by holding down a key until the number dials.  She just has to remember to hold the key down long enough for the speed dial to work.I really wish I could have seen and compared these "adult" phones before making a purchase.

Reviews.Title: it just works.
Reviews.Author: Brendan R. Davis "Davis Omnimedia"
Reviews.Content: It just works for any age user. It amazed me how easy it was for older people to use.  I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great for older person
Reviews.Author: louise
Reviews.Content: Ringer is very loud. Sound is clear. Would highly recommend this product.I only wish ratings were less words to right

Reviews.Title: Great product for grandparents (TALK, TEXT, FM) in the continent of North America only.
Reviews.Author: StanDaMan
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my grandma, and she loves the large characters. Well, lets face it, she only need it to TALK, once in a while TEXT, and she loves the fact that she can listen to her favorite FM or AM Radio channels.  However, I bought this item in the U.S. and ship it to Africa to learn that this phone is not UNLOCKED for international carriers. Yes, the phone works fine among the US carriers providers but not in Africa. Just a caveat to international buyers.  Else, the product is great for the purpose you intent to use.

Reviews.Title: Phone did not work.
Reviews.Author: Ankur
Reviews.Content: The phone did not work. It doesn't recognize the SIM card. I did make sure that SIM card is valid and active. Will not recommend buying it.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for my mom!
Reviews.Author: Billie Sutherland
Reviews.Content: This is a good phone for anyone hard of hearing.  It has amplified sound for the ringer and my mother can hear fine on it, even with her hearing aids.

Reviews.Title: NO SIGNAL
Reviews.Author: Nikohl A.
Reviews.Content: I sent this phone to my mom in the Philippines, thinking its a great idea for her to have this phone since she is 70 years old. The idea of this phone is great but how I will it will work as advertised. What a shame.

Reviews.Title: gift for my Mom
Reviews.Author: Nanny
Reviews.Content: I bought the phone for my elderly Mother who is home by her self alot. I love all ther features and safety buttons that will come in handy for her.

Reviews.Title: Just a phone!
Reviews.Author: Stella
Reviews.Content: I wanted a NEW phone that is just a phone.  I already have a computer, camera and GPS, and I don't need those things on my phone or want to pay for them.  The ring is LOUD--great because my husband is hard of hearing, he'd always say he couldn't hear the others.  The call received is loud enough for him too.  The buttons are big--great because he has big fingers, he'd always say he couldn't fit his fingers on others' buttons.  The lock button is simple, slide it to lock.  No more pressing a certain sequence of keys in rapid succession to lock the keypad.  The flashlight is a real flashlight folks, not a flashlight 'app.'  Yep, slide a button for that too.  We don't use the SOS button on back, so we disabled it, easy to do.  The battery lasts longer than any other cell phone I've ever had.  We love this phone, and affectionately call it our 'dumb' phone.  (And we'd prefer it to a smart phone any day.)

Reviews.Title: charger unusefull in us with ac current
Reviews.Author: jerry leenerts
Reviews.Content: had to be returned because of inadequate charger__no mention in add about charger not designed for us current, perhaps enough buyers dont bother bother to return them to make it worth sellers trouble.

Reviews.Title: Does not work
Reviews.Author: D. Carneiro
Reviews.Content: Bought it, as many others, for my mom, but can't get it working.  It turns on, but I think it is not an unlocked phone.  You insert the SIM card, but it does not make nor receive calls.  NOT recommend.

Reviews.Title: complicated for seniors
Reviews.Author: Mrs Dieng
Reviews.Content: it just  difficult ,of finding the speaker,and text you have to click to many buttons, but i would recommend this just 5 to other people

Reviews.Title: not for low vision
Reviews.Author: MO
Reviews.Content: It is a good phone.  The problem is the numbers are not easy to read.  They should have greater contrast.  This is not good for a low vision person.

Reviews.Title: Not what it says it is
Reviews.Author: Jackie G. Hicks "Jappy"
Reviews.Content: This phone does have big numbers & keys, but its not really any easier to use than any other one I've ever had. I bought it for my Mom (86) & it was pretty difficult for her to learn to use. It looks & feels like a cheap kids toy. I wouldn't recommend it. I give 2 stars for big buttons & numbers.

Reviews.Title: Does not work....
Reviews.Author: Missy
Reviews.Content: Can get it to work at all. More trouble than it is worth.  First 5 Support sucks too !!!!  Will not recommend.

Reviews.Title: It's perfect for my 8yo gradeschooler who has sitters and tutors
Reviews.Author: MommyMayI
Reviews.Content: My 8yo wanted a way to contact me whenever she wanted to without asking her baby sitter to call me on their phone. I also had hired a new tutor and I do want her to easily reach me when she wants to. I’m a full-time single mom so I hire sitters/tutors to do what I can’t when I am working. It makes sense now that she's well into grade school and asserting her independence which I encourage. However, I am still a firm believer that a mobile phone with all the bells and whistles (ie. texting, emailing, wireless surfing is too much too soon for her age) and this device comes with basic rules. It stays in a dedicated space in her backpack in locked mode especially during school hours. She calls me when she’s at her sitter’s house and if she has or doesn’t have enough snacks, or is not feeling well, etc. I feel connected hence relieved. Batter life is awesome, I charge it every weekly. I added her to my AT&T; service provider for $10/mo ($36 fee was waived as a courtesy) which they refer to as a family plan and we share my unlimited talk minutes, easy as pie.I did my research, narrowed it down to 4 models and this product was number 1 on that list of alternatives for her age group and purpose. Perks are only the numbers I program in it can call her. There will be no chatting with friends after school; she can talk to them when she’s in school. The SOS feature is a perk for obvious reasons. There is a texting feature but it's the old school press #2 to type in the letter "C" kind of thing. (I’m a PDA user so this feature isn’t very useful) She does not use this feature and I don’t send her texts. I actually didn’t set up her voicemail either. I wanted a simple device, does the job and the size of this phone is perfect for her little hands. The big buttons are user friendly. I chose white so that she could easily find it in the dark. I’m sure there is much more than I can say about this product  but reading all the reviews from people with varying needs and experiences truly was helpful to me and I’m happy to take the time to provide my feedback to offer the same for someone else.

Reviews.Title: The SOS button on the back is way too easy to bump.
Reviews.Author: Book Worm
Reviews.Content: The emergency SOS button on the back is way too easy to push. I got this for my Mom after she had taken a fall. Hoping she could use this to contact the family. The day after I got it, she accidentally bumped it and freaked us all out over nothing. Then it started having electrical issues and the buttons on the front randomly dont work.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Ronda Callaham
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my Mother.  Big mistake, it is to hard to get around to her address book, can't get to the voice mail to get her message. The only thing that does work well, it rings loud.  I am going to have to buy her a different kind of Senior cell phone.

Reviews.Title: Phones for parents!
Reviews.Author: RJE
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my dad and had already purchased a different color one for my mother. They are older and not computer savy so a smart phone would not do. This is a perfect, simple, easy-to-use phone for older people and I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Product faulty has bad design & LOW VOLUME ON CALLS
Reviews.Author: MIXUPAGAIN
Reviews.Content: Received phone fast...Thank You. However when you pick up or just handle the phone it sets off the volume control button on the side of phone and you have to manually turn it off, fumbling around while it is screamingly loud. In addition the call volume is weaker than my old iphone. Hard to hear the person calling you. The only thing Amplified is the dial buttons and the ringer volume. NOT the callers voice. Not Good.

Reviews.Title: Easy
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Hernandez
Reviews.Content: I Bought this for my father in law. He bought a cell phone and had no idea how to use it. He is loving his new phone! :)

ProductInfo.Features:
Extremely Easy to Use
Big Buttons
Amplified Sound
Personal Emergensy Response System (PERS)
Unlocked GSM phone
ProductInfo.Name: JUST5 J509 Easy to Use Unlocked Cell Phone with Big Buttons, Amplified Sound, Personal Emergency Response System (White)
